sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's Thursday, the 16th of June. Good morning, Europe. A very warm welcome to the program. Here are our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of civilians remain trapped in the Ukrainian city of Severodonetsk after plans for a humanitarian corridor failed to materialize.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: NATO and the U.S. promised more support for Ukraine, with Washington agreeing a security package of close to 1 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And as festival season gets underway in Europe, the WHO warns that the continent is at the epicentre of the monkeypox outbreak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UN has expressed grave concerns for the condition of civilians who remain trapped in Severodonetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hundreds are said to be bunkered down underneath the azote chemical plant with a reduced clean water supply, sanitation and electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A break in the shelling facilitating a humanitarian corridor never materialised, dashing hopes of an evacuation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Both sides blame each other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainians apparently ignoring the unilateral offer from the Russians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They claimed it was linked to a deadline to surrender.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for the UN's Humanitarian Affairs Office said that both parties to the conflict have an obligation under international humanitarian law to protect civilians, so it's not an option.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They have to assure the people who want to leave the city they can do it safely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky used his nightly address to thank US President Joe Biden for pledging another $1 billion worth of weapons aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Both the US and Zelensky have said the battle in the east of Ukraine has reached a pivotal moment in the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Russian military has, however, claimed to have used long-range missiles to destroy a depot in the western Lviv region where ammunition for NATO-supplied weapons was stored.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, mostly elderly and disabled residents from a small town on the edge of the Donetsk region arrived in western Ukraine after having been forced to abandon their homes because of the increasingly heavy fighting in Donbas. Ukraine is putting pressure on NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It hopes to receive more weapons and support from the alliance's members.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: NATO also wants to provide more support to Ukraine as the fighting in the Donbass enters its decisive phase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: more support to Ukraine as the fighting in the Donbas enters its decisive phase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The U.S. Defense Secretary spoke about the prospect of an additional aid package.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The United States will provide an additional $1 billion security assistance package for Ukraine and it includes guided MLRS munitions 18 more M triple seven howitzers and the tactical vehicles to tow them and 36 000 rounds of 155 millimeter ammunition package also includes 620 million euros for two more coastal defense systems and thousands of secure radios night vision devices and thermal sites in a message to the Czech Parliament the Ukrainian president made clear his country's requirements Ukraine must get everything to win modern and powerful weapons to gain an advantage over the Russian army, financial support, to have resources against Russia, whose revenues are still very high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the 100 days that this war has lasted, Russia has already earned 93 billion euros just for the sale of energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kiev says that so far it has received only 10% of all the money it has been promised by its allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: NATO defence ministers met on Wednesday in Brussels

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: where they focused on their coordinated effort to provide weapons and other kind of assistance to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Western allies have promised NATO standard weapons, including advanced US rockets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And the US Defense Minister, after having chaired a meeting of nearly 50 countries, he announced that the United States will provide an additional $1 billion in assistance, stressing that they are going to move faster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But deploying the weapons is taking time. And Ukraine already said that only 10% of the weapons promised to them by the Allies have been delivered so far. The Secretary General of NATO, Jens Stoltenberg, said that NATO defence ministers are also meeting today in Brussels to address these concerns and also discuss how to move from Soviet air equipment, that now Ukraine is mainly equipped with, to a more modern gear as the stocks of these weapons have now decreased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He also added that the Allies would continue to supply Ukraine with heavy weapons and that he expected them to agree a new package of assistance to give at NATO summit in Madrid end of June at the same time there is no estimate anymore on when Sweden and Finland may be able to join the Alliance as Turk is maintaining its opposition to both countries joining NATO unless they address its security concerns in the most official possible way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Diplomatic efforts are still ongoing, but it is highly uncertain that this issue will be solved by the meeting of NATO leaders in Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Efi Koutsakosta, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Belfast port custom checks are at the centre of legal action by the European Union launched on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU has begun proceedings against the United Kingdom following the British government's failure to implement parts of the Northern Ireland Protocol in the post-Brexit deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: EU Brexit Commissioner Maros Cerovic spoke in Brussels today. Let there be no doubt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There is no legal nor political justification whatsoever for unilaterally changing an international agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Opening the door to unilaterally changing an international agreement is a breach of international law as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So let's call it a spade a spade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is illegal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson insists that unilateral moves to change the Northern Ireland Protocol are vital to secure trade between Northern Ireland and the rest of the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU opposes the removal of custom checks on goods entering Northern Ireland from the rest of the UK and is frustrated by repeated calls to implement the agreement, which aims to safeguard the Good Friday Agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The United States Federal Reserve has raised its key interest rates in an effort to curb soaring inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The increase of 0.75% to between 1.5% to 1.7% is the largest hike in nearly three decades, and it could increase the risk of another recession.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The country is currently seeing its worst inflation rate since 1981, putting severe pressure on its people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We at the Fed understand the hardship that high inflation is causing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We're strongly committed to bringing inflation back down and we're moving expeditiously to do so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have both the tools we need and the resolve that it will take to restore price stability on behalf of American families and businesses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The U.S.'s announcement follows other central banks making similar moves, including the European Central Bank, which is poised to raise rates for the first time in 11 years. The raise is aimed at dealing with record inflation of 8.1 percent in the 19 countries that use the euro. However, some countries are worried that it could cause market turbulence in more indebted European countries. I am officially running for president of the United States,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: and we are going to make our country great again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Summer has arrived in Europe and with it has come a flurry of festivals and it would appear the largest outbreak of monkeypox outside of Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Monkeypox is a viral infection which mostly manifests as a rash and a fever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's transmitted through close physical contact, including during sex.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It also is spread by prolonged face-to-face contact through respiratory droplets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There have been 1,500 cases in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have entered the summer months in the Northern Hemisphere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 500 cases in Europe. We have entered the summer months in the Northern Hemisphere with summer tourism, various Pride events, music festivals and other mass gatherings planned across the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: These events are powerful opportunities to engage with young, sexually active and highly mobile people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Monkeypox is not a reason to cancel events but an opportunity to leverage them to drive our engagement. There have been 1,500 confirmed cases in Europe, 85% of the total global number of known cases. The World Health Organization says it's vital that event managers tell people how to protect themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The WHO advises isolating at home if you suspect you have symptoms and that objects and surfaces should be cleaned regularly if they are frequently touched.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Well, that's it from me and the rest of the newsroom here at our Lyon headquarters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
